phonetic: /sth E * no longer in a stated place or condition 不在（某处）；不处于（某种情况）1. An apple rolled out of the bag. 一个苹果从袋子里滚了出来。2. Professor Aitchison is out of town this week. 艾奇逊教授这星期不在城里。3. The patient is now out of danger. 病人现在脱离了危险期。4. The coffee machine is out of order (= does not work). 咖啡机出了故障。5. Both she and her husband are out of work (= no longer have jobs). 她和丈夫都失业了。 preposition MADE FROM  由…构成  E (also of) * used to show what something is made from 由…制成；由…构成1. The dress was made out of velvet. 这条裙子是用天鹅绒做的。 preposition BECAUSE OF  因为  A * used to show the reason why someone does something 出于，因为1. I took the job out of necessity because we had no money left. 我不得已接受了这份工作，因为我们没钱了。2. You might like to come and see what we're doing out of interest (= because I think you might be interested). 你也许有兴趣来看看我们在做甚么。 preposition FROM AMONG  从…当中  A * from among an amount or number 从（某个数量或数字）中1. Nine out of ten people said they liked the product. 十个人中有九个说他们喜欢这产品。2. No one got 20 out of 20 (= all the answers correct) in the test. 这次测试，没有人答对全部20道题。 preposition ORIGIN  起源  * used to describe where something came from or began 形容某事的起源、来历1. She dresses like a character out of a 19th century novel. 她穿得犹如19世纪小说中的人物。2. I paid for the computer out of (= using some of) my savings. 我用我的存款买了这台电脑。 preposition NOT INVOLVED  未参与的  [after verb] * no longer involved in 不再参与；退出1. He missed two practice sessions so he's out of the team. 他两次没有参加训练，所以现在已不是队里一员了。2. I'm out of the habit of cycling to work. 我已经改变了骑车上班的习惯。 preposition out of your mind/
